content: They'll find out anything they want about you, really. Besides, why would your brother take the risk and not tell them? Full disclosure or none at all. Pick one. And of course you can get your own records. Call the doc and tell 'em you want to pick them up or have them mailed to you. However, I don't imagine the military taking your copies as good. They're gonna want them straight from the doc's office. And the credit check? His best bet is to be upfront and honest. The way it was explained to me by my husband was if you carry too much debt, you're a security risk. Someone could offer to pay off everything for you, or give you a nice chunk of change in exchange for info. If he's serious about being in the military, he'll be serious about being upfront and honest on his paperwork. It wouldn't hurt, either, to start cracking away at his credit file to get it cleaned up.
